channel.title: Need help :(
channel.description: i was trying to get rsceasy to work with online i replaced the ip in the settings.ini file in the client but when i go to logon to my server and says check connection ect anyone know how to fix?

item.title: Need help :(
item.dc:creator: @Kurisu Kurisu
item.description:
@Kurisu wrote:

[quote=“bengina, post:9, topic:368694”][quote author=Kurisu link=topic=464834.msg3407963#msg3407963 date=1290466944]

so others can connect to me and ive already changed the server.java file from localhost to my internal ip
[/quote]wrong, make it the port forwarded ip
and use your internal for the settings

Wrong! He was right to use his internal ip in the server class as this allows a connection to the internet through his router and vise versa! If you are still having problems try this:

  1. Make sure you have ur internal ip (192.168…) in your server class and compile the server.
  2. Put your external ip in the settings file in your client.
  3. Make sure the ports match on the client and server and make sure you have portforwarded correctly.
    That should be it but if it still doesnt work then try the next step…
  4. Download no-ip and setup… Place the port and ip in the application as this will allow the connection through the port.

Hope this helps :D[/quote]
Dang you right, I read wrong haha

Read full topic

item.title: Need help :(
item.dc:creator: @bengina bengina
item.description:
@bengina wrote:

[quote=“Kurisu, post:8, topic:368694”][quote author=masterpowers link=topic=464834.msg3399161#msg3399161 date=1289756502]
so others can connect to me and ive already changed the server.java file from localhost to my internal ip
[/quote]wrong, make it the port forwarded ip
and use your internal for the settings[/quote]

Wrong! He was right to use his internal ip in the server class as this allows a connection to the internet through his router and vise versa! If you are still having problems try this:

  1. Make sure you have ur internal ip (192.168…) in your server class and compile the server.
  2. Put your external ip in the settings file in your client.
  3. Make sure the ports match on the client and server and make sure you have portforwarded correctly.
    That should be it but if it still doesnt work then try the next step…
  4. Download no-ip and setup… Place the port and ip in the application as this will allow the connection through the port.

Hope this helps

Read full topic

Search for the Server.Java file, And theres an ip in there you will need to edit.
